author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: LeBron James silences confident Wizards with milestone-filled performance
summary: Confidence is a necessary NBA asset, especially for aspiring contenders hoping to knock off the mainstay powerhouses. Fresh off their first division title since 1979 and a playoff run to Game 7 of the second round, the Washington Wizards carry confidence in spades. They are young and talented, and sharp-shooting guard Bradley Beal believes they are ready to take the step up to the top of their conference. "For us, we have all of our pieces. We got our core back together. We've got playoff experience. There's really no excuse for us not to take that next step," Beal told ESPN. "We control our own destiny at this point." "I feel like we're the best team [in the Eastern Conference]," Beal added.

author: DeltaBravo
title: There’s Some Good News About 401(k)s in the Tax Bill
summary: Hardship withdrawal and loan repayment rules are tweaked

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: LeBron James jumped all the way over Bradley Beal
summary: LeBron James apparently didn't feel like dribbling all the way around Bradley Beal in the third quarter of the Cavaliers' win over the Wizards on Friday night, so instead, James jumped over Beal. Or perhaps James just didn't see the Wizards guard on the floor in front of him until it was too late. Whatever happened, it turned into a goofy moment in the middle of a game in which the Cavaliers star put up monster numbers. James finished with an incredible 57 points, 11 rebounds, seven assists, three steals and two blocks. This victory broke the Cavs' four-game losing streak. Next, Cleveland will take on the Hawks on Sunday.

author: DeltaBravo
title: LeBron James First Half Highlights

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Cuban: Green owes apology for owner remark
summary: Tim MacMahon ESPN Staff Writer Close Joined ESPNDallas.com in September 2009 Covers the Dallas Cowboys and Dallas Mavericks Appears regularly on ESPN Dallas 103.3 FM Follow on Twitter DALLAS -- Mark Cuban says Golden State Warriors forward Draymond Green "owes the NBA an apology" for criticizing the use of the term "owner" in sports. Green made the statement last week in an Instagram post reacting to Houston Texans owner Bob McNair's controversial comment that the NFL "can't have inmates running the prison." "For starters, let's stop using the word owner and maybe use the word Chairman," Green wrote. "To be owned by someone just sets a bad precedent to start. It sets the wrong tone. It gives

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Redick's 3s, Simmons' Triple-Double Lead 76ers Over Pacers
summary: J.J. Redick scored 31 points and hit three decisive 3-pointers late, Ben Simmons had a triple-double and the Philadelphia 76ers moved above .500 for the first time in nearly four years with a 121-110 victory over the Indiana Pacers on Friday night. Simmons had 14 points, 11 rebounds and 11 assists for his second triple-double in a rookie season delayed a year because of injury. The Sixers (5-4) hadn't had a winning record since they were also 5-4 on Nov. 13, 2013, but their painful rebuild appears near an end as they won their fourth straight game. Victor Oladipo shook off a slow start to score 31 points, Bojan Bogdanovic added 21 and Myles Turner had 11 points and nine rebounds in his return from a concussion for the Pacers.

author: third_watch
title: Ben Simmons' Nike jersey gets ripped apart
summary: This hasn’t been the best NBA season for the new Nike jerseys.

author: captainunderoos
title: Kurtenbach: What we learned in the Warriors' 112-92 win over the Spurs
summary: How's that for a reversal? The Warriors, down 19 points in the first half to the Spurs Thursday, flipped the score on San Antonio in the second half of the rivals' first matchup of the year, opening a 21-point second-half lead — a 40-point turnaround — in what would be a 112-92 Golden State win. The second half showed us the Warriors at their best, but in both the first-half struggles and second half successes, there were lessons to be gleaned. Here's what we learned from the Warriors' sixth win of the year: 1. Numbers don't show Draymond Green's full impact on this Warriors' team Green turned around Thursday night's game. Yes, the Warriors chipped away at the Spurs' early 19-point lead with

author: DeltaBravo
title: Beyoncé shared her epic Lil’ Kim Halloween costumes, and here’s what the original Queen B thinks
summary: Queens recognize queens. That’s the statement that Queen Bey just made to the world yet again. Yesterday, Beyoncé shared pics of her Lil’…

author: DeltaBravo
title: Celtics rally past Thunder for seventh straight win
summary: Kyrie Irving brazenly led the Celtics to a 101-94 win over the Thunder Friday in Oklahoma City. Boston (7-2) trailed by 18 points at halftime, after only scoring 37 points in the first half. But Irving, who scored a team-high 25 points with six assists, led a second-half charge that captured the Celtics their seventh-straight win. The Celtics won the third quarter 30-16 after the Thunder — specifically Carmelo Anthony — went cold. Boston, smelling blood, completed the comeback with a 34-23 fourth quarter. Al Horford scored 20 points on 8-of-10 shooting, while also hauling in eight rebounds. Rookie Jayson Tatum added 13 points, and Jaylen Brown scored 10 points with 12 rebounds. Paul George led

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Should the Lakers Bench Lonzo Ball? Trail Blazers Shut Down Struggling Rookie Again
summary: On Thursday night at Moda Center in Portland, the Lakers lost for the fifth time this season, on a three-pointer by Damian Lillard as time expired. Lillard, a two-time All Star, finished with 32 points, six rebounds and five assists—the kind of numbers you expect regularly from an elite point guard eight games into his sixth NBA season. Ball attempted two shots, according to ESPN, missed both of them, and ended the game with four assists, three rebounds, two blocks and a steal.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Morris makes presence felt in impressive C's debut
summary: Marcus Morris, playing in his first game as a Celtic, is instrumental in the third-quarter surge that set the stage for Boston's victory

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Thunder shrug off second-half collapse as part of coming together
summary: Royce Young ESPN Staff Writer Close Covers the Oklahoma City Thunder for ESPN.com Follow on Twitter OKLAHOMA CITY -- It's entirely cliché to label a game "a tale of two halves," but in the Oklahoma City Thunder's 101-94 loss on Friday to the Boston Celtics, as both Billy Donovan and Carmelo Anthony said, there's not much of a better way to describe it. First half: Thunder 55, Celtics 37. Second half: Celtics 64, Thunder 39. "Who we can be was out in front of us the first 24 minutes," Donovan said. "And what we can be on the other end of it, the second 24 minutes." The first half was a whirling display of the Thunder's raw power and potential, with a suffocating defense clamping down on Kyrie

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Spurs reserves spark victory over Hornets
summary: Tenacious. Gritty. That was how Gregg Popovich and Patty Mills summed up the Spurs' 108-101 win over Charlotte on Friday night, words that could also describe the guys that led the charge in the victory. On the second night of a back-to-back and still down three key players, the Spurs found a way to snap their losing skid while facing a Hornets team that had won three straight, bringing a physical intensity and getting some big contributions from the bench. The physicality could be seen in the box score, where the two teams combined for 70 free-throw attempts. Twenty of those were taken by Hornets center Dwight Howard, who was consistently swarmed by white jerseys every time he touched the ball

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Kelly Oubre Jr.'s NSFW fur coat has a message for you
summary: Kelly Oubre Jr. wants everyone to peep the fur coat he wore to DC’s Verizon Center. Kelly Oubre Jr. has had quite an eventful start to his third NBA season. One week after his rash decision to take a swing at a Golden State Warrior ended with him accidentally punching John Wall in the head and paying a $15,000 fine to the NBA, Oubre is under the NBA’s microscope again.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Mark Cuban: Draymond Green should apologize for comments on ownership
summary: Dallas Mavericks owner Mark Cuban says the Golden State Warriors' Draymond Green should apologize for his choice of words in a critical Instagram post, according to an ESPN report. Green, the former Michigan State star, was responding to the controversial comments from Houston Texans owner Bob McNair, who said the NFL "can't have inmates running the prison." Green wrote on Instagram: "Let's stop using the word owner and maybe use the word chairman. To be owned by someone just sets a bad precedent to start. It sets the wrong tone. It gives one the wrong mindset.” Cuban said Green's failure to make a distinction between owning teams and owing people was irresponsible. Cuban told ESPN of Green:

author: nanook
title: Manu Ginobili, age 40, broke out a Eurostep and dunked on Frank Kaminsky
summary: Manu Ginobili played in his 1000th NBA game on Friday. He's in his 16th NBA season, having played professionally in Europe until he was 25. He turned 40 years old over the summer, and decided to sign with the San Antonio Spurs for two more seasons. He's one of just 20 NBA players ever to appear in a game at age 40 or older. (A brief aside: This season is the first in league history in which there are three 40-year-olds with appearances: Manu, Vince Carter, and Jason Terry. Until Carter turned 40 in the middle of last season, there hadn't been a 40-year-old in the league since Grant Hill and Kurt Thomas in 2013. Now we have three! Back to Manu.) Paul Flannery wrote a beautiful, prescient piece

author: DeltaBravo
title: Warriors Tonight: Why the Nuggets could spell trouble
summary: THE BASICS Tipoff: 6 p.m. Saturday at the Pepsi Center. TV: NBC Sports Bay Area. Radio: KGMZ 95.7 “The Game” in Oakland and San Francisco, KRTY 95.3 in San Jose, KION 1460 and 101.1 in Salinas and Monterey. THE RECORDS Warriors: 6-3, a half-game behind Houston in the Western Conference. Nuggets: 5-4, 1½ games behind Houston in the Western Conference. WHAT HAVE THEY DONE LATELY Warriors: Golden State blitzed San Antonio in the second half en route to a 112-92 road victory on Thursday night. Klay Thompson scored 27 points on 11-of-17 shooting from the field, including 5 of 8 from 3-point range. Kevin Durant missed his first eight shots, but finished with 24 points on 9-for-18 shooting. Nuggets:

author: DeltaBravo
title: Steve Kerr told a great story about how he got Gregg Popovich to always pay for his dinners
summary: Spurs head coach Gregg Popovich always picks up the tab when he runs into his players while out to eat. Former Spur and current Warriors head coach Steve Kerr would ask the hotel concierge where Popovich was dining and surprise him at the restaurant in hopes of scoring a free meal. Popovich and Kerr may be rivals when it comes to coaching, but they remain friendly away from the court. San Antonio Spurs head coach Gregg Popovich and Golden State Warriors head coach Steve Kerr went out to dinner together on Wednesday night, and it brought to light a funny story from when both men worked for the same organization. It began when Kerr revealed that Popovich pays for his players' meals whenever he

author: captainunderoos
title: Gameday: Warriors go for sweep of road trip in Denver without key reserve
summary: After starting 1-2, the Warriors are closing in on the top record in the West. A win on Saturday against the Nuggets will help the cause.

author: captainunderoos
title: Fred Hoiberg doesn't commit to Bobby Portis playing Tuesday
summary: Saturday was the eighth and final game of Bobby Portis' suspension for punching Nikola Mirotic. But it's an open question whether Portis will play Tuesday when the Bulls face the Raptors in Toronto. Bulls coach Fred Hoiberg was asked before Saturday's game against the New Orleans Pelicans if Portis will play Tuesday, and Hoiberg was noncommittal. “We'll see,” Hoiberg said. “He's been practicing, so we'll see how tonight goes and get a couple good days of practice and then take it from there.” As for Mirotic, Hoiberg said the forward has been coming in every day and “getting workouts.” His workload on the bike is increasing and he's been able to get into a pool, but is still not doing anything

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Future comes early for Lakers and Kyle Kuzma
summary: LOS ANGELES – The Lakers always believed the 2017 NBA draft would be a night that the franchise would take a big step into the future. They just had no idea how much of that would have to do with Kyle Kuzma. What began in summer league and continued through the preseason has not faded nine games into the regular season. Kuzma, the 27th pick in the draft, has been one of the Lakers most dynamic players and their second-leading scorer,  averaging 15.7 points per game. And after a 21-point performance in Friday's win over Brooklyn, he appears poised to start at power forward for a long, long time. Every time he unleashed a 3-pointer, the arena erupted into drawn-out shouts of “Kuuuuz!” waiting for

author: third_watch
title: Pistons looking like Eastern Conference contenders, Warriors win
summary: The Detroit Pistons were led by Avery Bradley, who guided them to victory over the Sacramento Kings in the NBA.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Nets' only bright spot in Lakers loss finally finding his rhythm
summary: There were precious few bright spots in Friday's defeat against the Lakers, but Allen Crabbe was one of them. “I'm a shooter,” Crabbe shrugged. Coach Kenny Atkinson has steadfastly maintained Crabbe was out of sync because he missed so much time. “I think he's finding his rhythm.

author: third_watch
title: Anthony Davis, DeMarcus Cousins lead Pelicans in 96-90 OT win over Bulls
summary: Anthony Davis had 27 points and 16 rebounds to lead the New Orleans Pelicans.

author: third_watch
title: Cavaliers to keep Derrick Rose on minutes restriction, report says
summary: Derrick Rose has been one of the most injury-riddled stars of any sport over the last five years. The Cavaliers point guard has already missed four games this season with an ankle injury, and Cleveland has chosen a cautious approach with him moving forward. "Let me say, for one, I'm just happy to be a part of this team, part of something that I think is special," Rose told ESPN.com. "A minute restriction, there's nothing I can do about that. But with me having all these injuries in my past, I'm kind of used to it. But whatever the team sees and the staff sees and they want me to do, that's what I'm going to cooperate with and just go about it the right way." According to the ESPN report, Rose

author: third_watch
title: Road Warriors find their mojo in dominant three-game sweep
summary: For those who were worried after a slow 4-3 start, take a look at what the Warriors just did on the road and you'll see how special they can be.

author: third_watch
title: Lakers look to extend streak vs. Grizzlies
summary: The Los Angeles Lakers will try to win their fourth straight game against the Memphis Grizzlies at Staples Center when they meet Sunday evening. The Lakers started the streak on March 22, 2016, and beat visiting Memphis again Jan. 3 and April 2 of last season.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: GAME RECAP: Timberwolves 112, Mavericks 99
summary: Now Playing GAME RECAP: Timberwolves 112, Mavericks 99 Karl-Anthony Towns scores 31 points and grabs 12 rebounds, Andrew Wiggins adds 23 points on 9-for-14 shooting and the Minnesota Timberwolves beat the floundering Dallas Mavericks 112-99 for their first four-game winning streak in nearly five years. 38 minutes ago

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: New York Knicks: Analyzing Michael Beasley's production so far
summary: New York Knicks head coach Jeff Hornacek doesn't seem to be eager to give Michael Beasley a consistent role in the rotation. Should that change? Scoring 11 points may not seem like an achievement, but Michael Beasley has a lot to be proud of following his performance on Friday night. It was the veteran forward's largest output of his first season with the New York Knicks In 17 minutes against the Phoenix Suns, Beasley managed to pick and choose his battles, making five of his seven shot attempts. He also pulled down four rebounds, matching a season-high. It was Beasley's most complete performance of the season. That may not be any fault of his own, though. Through eight games this season, the

author: nanook
title: Warriors' Green leaves Cuban criticism alone
summary: Chris Haynes ESPN Staff Writer Close Follow on Twitter DENVER -- Golden State Warriors forward Draymond Green acknowledged Saturday that he has read Dallas Mavericks owner Mark Cuban's remarks about him, but he elected not to comment further on the matter. Asked if he was advised not to address Cuban's comments to ESPN, Green responded: "Nobody can prep me. I'm going to always say what I want. Ain't no prepping me. At all. Ever. Don't ever believe that. Can't prep me for nothing. Don't ever think that. "I do live in America. However, you can't prep me for nothing. Don't ever think I've been prepped for an interview. Don't work like that." A day earlier, Cuban told ESPN's Tim MacMahon that Green

author: nanook
title: Warriors give Zaza hard time about fastbreak vs Nuggets: '#TragicJohnson'
summary: In a game full of highlights, Zaza Pachulia turned in the best play of the night. Afterwards, he got a little ribbing from his coach and teammates.

author: nanook
title: Some full court pregame work for Isaiah Thomas. The Cavs timeline for
summary: Some full court pregame work for Isaiah Thomas. The Cavs timeline for him is supposed to keep him out another 6-7 weeks, but he is looking pretty strong already. Video by Dave McMenamin

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Rose stripped by son during pregame warmups
summary: Cavs PG Derrick Rose tries to show off his dribbling moves, but his son strips him of the ball.

author: captainunderoos
title: #SoleWatch: Stephen Curry Warms Up in New Curry 4 Lows
summary: The Under Armour Curry 4 Low hasn't been launched yet, but Stephen Curry continues to tease new colorways during pregame warmups. Ahead of tonight's matchup against the Denver Nuggets, Curry was spotted wearing this Championship-flavored pair in royal blue and gold. The tongue tab reads 'We Back,' presumably referencing the Warriors' title defense. A release date for the Curry 4 Low hasn't been announced.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: GAME RECAP: Hawks 117, Cavaliers 115

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Lakers News: Luke Walton Says Kyle Kuzma Is 'Better Than Any Of Us Anticipated'
summary: The Los Angeles Lakers have made a habit out of finding talent late in the NBA Draft, but Kyle Kuzma just may be their best late-round selection in recent memory. The rookie forward out of Utah has impressed since day one and has now stepped into the starting lineup thanks to an unfortunate injury to Larry Nance Jr. With the modern NBA requiring versatility above all else, players with Kuzma's skill set have become increasingly valuable. Defensively, he can switch in pick-and-roll situations while also possessing the ability to act as a spot-up-shooter, playmaker, and scorer on the offensive end. Despite his abilities, no one, including the Lakers, expected Kuzma to be quite this good this soon,

author: Kevin Kaduk
title: Gregg Popovich reacts to Sutherland Springs shooting: 'It's just inconceivable'
summary: In the wake of Sunday’s mass shooting in nearby Sutherland Springs, a somber Gregg Popovich said he believed it was “inappropriate” to talk about basketball. “We won a basketball game, but considering what’s going on today, it’s pretty meaningless,” Popovich said after his team’s 112-95 win over the Suns in San Antonio. With that, Popovich ended his postgame media availability and head back into the locker room.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Carmelo Anthony ejected after the most baffling call
summary: Sunday's game between the Thunder and Trail Blazers had its share of chippiness, but that didn't excuse one of the more ridiculous calls we'll see this NBA season. Carmelo Anthony had already been hit with a technical foul in the game, and when he drove for a layup over Jusuf Nurkic, his elbow caught Nurkic on the double-pump. Anthony made the shot, and the initial ruling on the court was a foul on Nurkic. But when the officials went to review the foul, they stunned everyone - especially Anthony - with a Flagrant 2. Yes, Anthony did catch Nurkic with the elbow, but it was clearly a part of his movement towards the basket and his shot attempt. After all, the move was necessary for Anthony to make

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: 'They're all shot.' One Sutherland Springs family loses three members in church shooting
summary: She ran inside and woke a napping Michael. His brother Chris, whose family often attends services there, wasn't answering his phone so the two hopped in the car and sped to his house to check they were safe. "He was pissed at me," Michael said. His brother didn't think it could be true — not in their small town. He thought Michael must be wrong, he had to be mistaken. Chris works the night shift and had stayed home that morning, but his wife and children were at the church. "I said, 'I'm not lying to you, Chris, they're all shot." Chris ran from the house toward the church, leaving his shoes behind. In the first hours after the shooting Sunday, some media erroneously reported Chris Ward was the

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Gilbert Arenas Says Lonzo Ball Is Okay, But The Other Lakers Suck Bad
summary: Gilbert Arenas thinks Lonzo Ball is off to a pretty decent start, but tells TMZ Sports they can't really shine in L.A. just yet BECAUSE THE REST OF HIS TEAM IS SUPER TRASH. Here's Gil's point ... Lonzo is a passer, and in order for him to tear it up for the Purple & Gold, his teammates have to make the shots he sets them up for, something Arenas says these guys can't do. "You try to put so much hype around a point guard but your team is bad. He can't make these players good, if they're Hondas they're Hondas. This is not fast in furious where you can put some Nitrous on Ingram and make him a better Honda." Ouch. Arenas went on to explain that no point guards make all the greats like Shaq and Jordan

author: DeltaBravo
title: Lakers' Lonzo Ball earns respect, and a win, against another top point guard
summary: A fan of Lonzo Ball started opposite the Lakers rookie Sunday night at Staples Center. That was Memphis' Mike Conley, a 10-year veteran who was once in Ball's shoes as a highly drafted point guard. “He's handled his situation about as good as anybody could,” Conley said before the game. “He seems like a great player, great attitude. All about the team. He's my kind of player in a sense. I like guys who are unselfish, who are about the wins more than anything else. “He's got a lot of room to grow obviously, but he'll be fantastic for this league going forward and end up being a star.” Conley posed yet another tough challenge for Ball, who already had faced Washington's John Wall and Portland's

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Atlanta Hawks stun Cleveland Cavaliers to end eight-game slide
summary: CLEVELAND -- Whatever else happens to the Atlanta Hawks this season, they will always have this. Dennis Schroder scored a season-high-tying 28 points, and the Hawks, depleted and losers of eight straight, beat the Cleveland Cavaliers 117-115 on Sunday afternoon. The Hawks were without five rotation players and had not won since opening night. They have made no secret that this was to be a rebuilding year, and it was the Cavaliers who swept them out of two straight playoff series in 2015 and 2016 when Atlanta was a formidable Eastern Conference contender. The Cavaliers, meanwhile, are the reigning Eastern champs three times over, but they look nothing like their old selves, either. "(Cleveland

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Schroeder, Hawks end 8-game skid, beat Cavaliers 117-115
summary: Coming off LeBron James' 57-point performance, it appeared the Cavaliers had finally gained some momentum. Dennis Schroeder scored 28 points and the injury-riddled Atlanta Hawks ended an eight-game losing streak, beating skidding Cleveland 117-115 on Sunday. The Hawks hadn't won since beating Dallas on Oct. 18 and were missing five players, but the Cavaliers went down to yet another puzzling loss.

author: DeltaBravo
title: How sustainable is the early success of the NBA's five most surprising teams?
summary: Monday marks the start of the fourth week of the NBA season, enough time to begin seeing trends around the league. One focuses on a handful of teams outpacing preseason projections through their first 10 games, looking like they have a chance to prove their doubters wrong over the course of the next few months. But will they? Or is the success experienced by those teams only fleeting, and likely to regress? That's what we'll attempt to decipher, as we look at the five most surprising teams in the NBA in an attempt to decide whether their play can last or is a case of playing above their heads. 1. Boston Celtics Unlike every other team on this list, the Celtics came into this season with sky-high

author: DeltaBravo
title: Lamar Odom Collapses in Nightclub, Rep Says He’s ‘Doing Great’
summary: The rep says he suffered from dehydration after an intense workout earlier in the day.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: It took nine games to show how poisonous Phil-Carmelo era was
summary: On a night Carmelo Anthony got ejected for a flagrant 2 foul in a Thunder loss, Kristaps Porzingis notched 40 points. On a night Anthony was tossed for what looked more like a regular offensive foul than an automatic flagrant ejection, Porzingis started getting superstar calls from the refs during his spectacular second-half rampage against the Pacers. On a night the Thunder fell to 4-5, the Knicks moved to 5-4, winners of five of six. Sunday truly felt like a seminal evening at the Garden, a night the Anthony era could not have felt more distant.

author: captainunderoos
title: Lakers Rumors: Latest Buzz on Possible Mindaugas Kuzminskas Trade
summary: Not every NBA trade is worthy of front-page headlines, but many times the small moves end up making a significant difference over the course of a season. This could be the case with Mindaugas Kuzminskas, who is reportedly on the trade block after struggling to find playing time with the New York Knicks this season. According to Marc Berman of the New York Post, the player's representatives were gauging interest around the league for a potential trade. He noted the Lakers, Cavaliers and Hawks were among those in the hunt for the small forward when he originally signed with New York, and this interest could lead to a trade. Los Angeles could especially be an intriguing option based on the current
